Description of other changes: Points of Rediversion Added; See Order Dated 10/21/2013

Description of intake location changes: Point of diversion was destroyed by fire, Current diversions are made downstream at Silverwood Lake. Quantities diverted do not exceed licensed quantities. There are no other authorized diversions between historic point of diversion and Silverwood Lake
Description of other changes: Temporary Urgency Change in terms and conditions requiring compliance with Delta Water Quality Objectives in Response to Drought, 2/3/15 and 7/3/15 Orders

Description of intake location changes: The place of use under this application and license was sold by the original permittee, together with additional land holdings, to the applicant of the Water Rights Application 23475 (pending). The present permittee desires to maintain this application and license until permits are issued under pending applications 23475 or 24257 (an application to consolidate all of the permittee?s holdings). The point of diversion under this application has been abandoned due to drought and water quality problems. Water used under this application has been purchased from Tahoe City Public Utility District, which has a variety of groundwater sources. The permittee intends to reestablish a point of diversion at the point identified under pending applications 23475 and 24257. This action and resolution of Lake Tahoe Basin Water Rights will resolve the non-compliance issues of this application. Resolution of water rights allocations is still pending subsequent to resolution of any possible legal challenges and implementation period of the Truckee River Operating Agreement. Water use as intended under this application and license continues to be beneficially used.
Description of other changes: additional temporary points of rediversion involving transfer, as authorized in order issued March 23, 2016; CPOU transfer under May 17, 2016 order
Description of place of use changes: Added instream flow dedication to implement the SJRRP under a temporary change order.
Description of type of use changes: Added fish and wildlife to implement the SJRRP under a temporary change order.
